The controversy involves accusations of plagiarism, particularly in SBI's Ecowrap, which allegedly mirrors RBI's Monetary Policy documents.

items.title: Old ornaments shine anew as festive gold swaps surge

items.title: RBI raises ceiling, value for loans taken against shares and debt MFs

items.title: Piyush Pandey, man behind some of India's most loved ads, is no more

Renowned for iconic campaigns like 'Hamara Bajaj' and 'Fevicol ka Mazboot Jod,' Pandey infused Indian advertising with local flavour, emotion, and authenticity. His work transcended product promotion, becoming deeply embedded in India's cultural fabric.

items.title: HUL is working to make its brands modern, youthful: Priya Nair

The company is changing packaging, marketing, and introducing new products. HUL is focusing on fewer, larger investments to drive growth across different consumer groups. This transformation is happening as India's consumer market evolves.

items.title: SBI and Bank of Baroda to launch Indian digital payment intelligence corporation to combat fraud
items.summary: India's largest banks, SBI and Bank of Baroda, are spearheading a new digital payments intelligence platform. This initiative aims to detect and prevent fraudulent transactions across all banks in real time. All 12 state-run banks will hold equity in the proposed entity, named Indian Digital Payment Intelligence Corporation. This move strengthens risk management amid rising bank frauds.

items.title: Life insurers, distributors in talks to recast terms
items.summary: Insurers are renegotiating terms with distributors.  This follows the government's GST exemption for individual life insurance policies.  The change has disrupted commission structures and profitability.  Large distributors are protecting margins. Smaller intermediaries and agency networks may face challenges.  Companies are adjusting operations and engaging with distributors to manage the impact.

items.title: Google leases office property in Gurugram
items.summary: US tech giant Google has secured a significant office space of 617,000 sq ft in Gurugram. This major deal at Atrium Place highlights Google's expanding presence in India. The company is committed to growing its operations and office footprint. This move follows previous leasing activities by Google in the region.

items.title: October business activity eases to five-month low as services slow down
items.summary: October brought a pause in India's private sector momentum, with growth sliding to a five-month low. The services industry faced a setback, weighing down on the overall economic landscape. On a brighter note, manufacturing gained traction from GST rate cuts, although US tariffs continued to cast a pall over new export opportunities and overall business sentiment.

items.title: Market outreach: 26 countries identified to expand rice exports
items.summary: India is gearing up to enhance its rice export strategy, reaching out to 26 different countries. The upcoming Bharat International Rice Conference 2025 will focus on penetrating fresh markets while striving to eliminate imports worth ₹1.8 lakh crore. This event promises to exhibit innovative AI-driven grading methods for rice.

items.title: DoT won't accept new applications from Nov 10
items.summary: From November 10, the Department of Telecommunication will no longer accept new licence applications. This temporary suspension is a preparatory step for implementing the new authorisation framework dictated by the Telecommunications Act 2023. Existing licences will automatically evolve upon renewal, but telcos are understandably anxious about possible alterations in their contracts.

items.title: India, US ‘very close’ to sealing trade pact: Both sides converge on core issues, legal language being finalised amid tariff uncertainties
items.summary: The United States and India are nearing the completion of an innovative bilateral trade pact. As both countries engage in constructive dialogues, they’re discovering shared interests. This agreement departs from traditional free trade formats. President Trump recently held a conversation with Prime Minister Modi focused on this partnership.

items.title: RBI seeks gold comfort over dollar assets

items.title: Bernstein stays cautious on India exposure, prefers low volatility, large-caps
